comments.body:
the issues with sparse encoding typically came when encoding an internal version, e.g. &batch.CronJob{}

this test is fine, but doesn't really exercise the failing case. since we're excising the internal->"find an external version to encode" paths in kubectl, this test is sufficient to cover the cases we care about

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@
	encoder := Codecs.LegacyCodec(v1.SchemeGroupVersion, v1beta1.SchemeGroupVersion)
	cronjobBytes, err := runtime.Encode(encoder, src)
	if err != nil {
		t.Fatal(err)
